intro: Hieracium asbololepis, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are hairy and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium asbololepis is known for its resilience to harsh climatic conditions and is often found at high altitudes.
